summary.para: Completes any necessary operations on the object and releases the object.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, possible return codes include, but are not limited to, the values shown in the following table.

description.para: The has not been opened for reading with a call to or the object has been closed for writing with a call to .

param.name: metadataItems
param.para: A pointer to an object to be opened for reading

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, possible return codes include, but are not limited to, the values shown in the following table.

item.description: Open has already been called on the supplied since the object was created or since the last call to .

description.para: The provided pointer is not valid.

summary.para: Gets the number of commands and the sample offset for the metadata item being read.

param.name: commandCount
param.para: Receives the number of command/value pairs in the metadata item being read.

param.name: frameOffset
param.para: Gets the frame offset associated with the metadata item being read.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, possible return codes include, but are not limited to, the values shown in the following table.

description.para: The has not been opened for reading with a call to or the object has been closed for writing with a call to .
There are no more metadata items in the frame range specified in the call to ReadItemCountInFrames.
One of the provided pointers is not valid.

remarks.para: Before calling ReadNextItem, you must open the for reading by calling after the object is created and after Close has been called. You must also call ReadItemCountInFrames before calling ReadNextItem.

The keeps an internal pointer to the current position within the total range of frames contained by the with which the reader is associated. Each call to this method causes the pointer to be advanced by the number of frames specified in the readFrameCount parameter.

The process for reading commands and the associated values is recursive. After each call to ReadItemCountInFrames, call ReadNextItem to get the number of commands in the next item. After every call to ReadNextItem, call to read each command for the item. Repeat this process until the entire frame range of the ISpatialAudioMetadataItems has been read.

summary.para: Reads metadata commands and value data for the current item.

param.name: commandID
param.para: Receives the command ID for the current command.

param.name: valueBuffer
param.para: A pointer to a buffer which receives data specific to the command as specified by the metadata format definition. The buffer must be at least maxValueBufferLength to ensure all commands can be successfully retrieved.

param.name: maxValueBufferLength
param.para: The maximum size of a command value.

param.name: valueBufferLength
param.para: The size, in bytes, of the data written to the valueBuffer parameter.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, possible return codes include, but are not limited to, the values shown in the following table.

description.para: The has not been opened for reading with a call to or the object has been closed for writing with a call to .
One of the provided pointers is not valid.

remarks.para: Before calling ReadNextItem, you must open the for reading by calling after the object is created and after Close has been called. You must also call ReadItemCountInFrames and then call before calling ReadNextItem.

The keeps an internal pointer to the current position within the total range of frames contained by the with which the reader is associated. Each call to this method causes the pointer to be advanced by the number of frames specified in the readFrameCount parameter.

The process for reading commands and the associated values is recursive. After each call to ReadItemCountInFrames, call to get the number of commands in the next item. After every call to ReadNextItem, call ReadNextItemCommand to read each command for the item. Repeat this process until the entire frame range of the ISpatialAudioMetadataItems has been read.

summary.para: Provides methods for extracting spatial audio metadata items and item command value pairs from an object. The SpatialAudioMetadataItems object, which is populated using an or , has a frame count, specified with the frameCount parameter to , that represents the valid range of metadata item offsets. ISpatialAudioMetadataReader enables reading back groups of items within a subrange of the total frame count. The object maintains an internal read position, which is advanced by the number of frames specified when read operation is performed.
This interface is a part of Windows Sonic, Microsoft’s audio platform for more immersive audio which includes integrated spatial sound on Xbox and Windows.
